oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Sonny Curtis - 2017-04-01
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by Sonny Curtis from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on April 1, 2017.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Sonny Curtis;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-ion Music / (05:05) Opening comments and introduction of Sonny Curtis by Michael Gray / (10:44) Opening comments by Sonny Curtis / (12:08) Performs Walk Right Back / (16:12) Performs He Was On To Somethin' (So He Made You) / (19:11) Sonny talks about working a show having to perform his best and worst written songs / (22:07) Performs Clone / (25:32) Sonny talks about learning to play the guitar from his grandmother and working with Buddy Holly / (30:56) Performs The Real Buddy Holly Story / (34:40) Tells story about song writing with Jerry Allison and story about Bobby Vee / (37:26) Performs More Than I Can Say / (39:41) Tells story about Mary Tyler Moore and his involvement with her tv show / (44:59) Performs Love Is All Around (Mary Tyler Moore Show / (47:36) Talks about writing the song I'm No Stranger To The Rain / (48:12) Performs I'm No Stranger To The Rain / (50:55) Performs I Fought The Law / (52:34) Closing comments from Sonny / (53:00) Walk-out Music /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Curtis, Sonny; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
